filters

Class FastICA

  • java.lang.Object
    • filters.FastICA

  • public class FastICA
extends java.lang.Object
    FastICA port of Python scikit-learn implementation.
    Author:
    Chris Gearhart

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FastICA()
      Default FastICA instance using the LogCosh() function to estimate negative entropy and whitening/mean-centering of the data matrix with simple default values.
      FastICA(double tolerance, int max_iter)
      FastICA instance using the LogCosh() function to estimate negative entropy and whitening/mean-centering of the data matrix.
      FastICA(double tolerance, int max_iter, boolean whiten)
      FastICA instance using the LogCosh() function to estimate negative entropy and mean-centering with opitonal whitening of the data matrix.
      FastICA(NegativeEntropyEstimator g_func, double tolerance, int max_iter, boolean whiten)
      General FastICA instance constructor with an arbitrary (user-supplied) function to estimate negative entropy.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fit(double[][] data, int num_components)
      Estimate the unmixing matrix for the data provided
      double[][] getEM()
      Return the estimated mixing matrix that maps sources to the data domain S * em = X
      double[][] getK()
      Return the pre-whitening matrix that was used on the data (defaults to the identity matrix)
      double[][] getW()
      Return the matrix that projects the data into the ICA domain
      double[][] transform(double[][] data)
      Project a row-indexed matrix of data into the ICA domain by applying the pre-whitening and un-mixing matrices.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastICA

        public FastICA(NegativeEntropyEstimator g_func,
               double tolerance,
               int max_iter,
               boolean whiten)
        General FastICA instance constructor with an arbitrary (user-supplied) function to estimate negative entropy. This implementation does not perform automatic component selection or reduction.
        Parameters:
        data - 2d array of doubles containing the source data; each column contains a single signal, and each row contains one sample of all signals (rows contain instances, columns are features)
        g_func - NegativeEntropyEstimator to estimate negative entropy
        tolerance - maximum allowable convergence error
        max_iter - max number of iterations
        whiten - whiten the data matrix (default true)

      • FastICA

        public FastICA(double tolerance,
               int max_iter,
               boolean whiten)
        FastICA instance using the LogCosh() function to estimate negative entropy and mean-centering with opitonal whitening of the data matrix. This implementation does not perform automatic component selection or reduction.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - maximum allowable convergence error
        max_iter - max number of iterations
        whiten - whiten the data matrix (default true)

      • FastICA

        public FastICA(double tolerance,
               int max_iter)
        FastICA instance using the LogCosh() function to estimate negative entropy and whitening/mean-centering of the data matrix. This implementation does not perform automatic component selection or reduction.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - maximum allowable convergence error
        max_iter - max number of iterations

      • FastICA

        public FastICA()
        Default FastICA instance using the LogCosh() function to estimate negative entropy and whitening/mean-centering of the data matrix with simple default values.

    • Method Detail

      • getW

        public double[][] getW()
        Return the matrix that projects the data into the ICA domain
        Returns:
        W double[][] matrix containing estimated independent component projection matrix

      • getK

        public double[][] getK()
        Return the pre-whitening matrix that was used on the data (defaults to the identity matrix)
        Returns:
        K double[][] matrix containing the pre-whitening matrix

      • getEM

        public double[][] getEM()
        Return the estimated mixing matrix that maps sources to the data domain S * em = X
        Returns:
        em double[][] matrix containing the estimated mixing matrix

      • transform

        public double[][] transform(double[][] data)
        Project a row-indexed matrix of data into the ICA domain by applying the pre-whitening and un-mixing matrices. This method should not be called prior to running fit() with input data.
        Parameters:
        data - rectangular double[][] array containing values; the number of columns should match the data provided to the fit() method for training
        Returns:
        result rectangular double[][] array containing the projected output values

      • fit

        public void fit(double[][] data,
                int num_components)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Estimate the unmixing matrix for the data provided
        Parameters:
        data - - 2d array of doubles containing the data; each column contains a single signal, and each row contains one sample of all signals (rows contain instances, columns are features)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
